Relative Font Size in Quotes

18
Luxelle
Wednesday, August 9th, 2017, 2:19:36 PM

When someone has quoted another message, the quote appears in a much larger font than the actual post does.

It took me until just now to realize it. i was registering a general confusion of comprehension as I was reading messages and trying to decipher what was being talked about.

I kinda think this is a UX gotcha. If someone were using the quote for a callout on a long piece, the larger font would make sense.

But when it is a reference to something that is now going to be further addressed, it just makes my brain hurt, I guess.

I'm hoping there's an easy CSS fix to this.

Flimbo
Wednesday, August 9th, 2017, 2:37:09 PM

Should just be a quick rem size change in the theme css if they want to change it, yeah.

Edit: in the meantime, and you may already know of it, while it's not a perfect fix: Hold control and roll your mouse ball to change the size of sites/text in most browsers

Luxelle
Wednesday, August 9th, 2017, 2:48:10 PM

But those Windows instructions won't help just one style of text, that's the whole ball of wax...

Flimbo
Wednesday, August 9th, 2017, 2:49:40 PM

Yeah it's by no means a full on solution for that particular issue. But it would help with...somebody else's issue where they mentioned the text in general was too big on this theme and I forgot to say anything, so, better late and in the wrong place than never! Also, whoever said that: Blame cell phones and tablets. That's why everything's all huge texted.

ondreian
Wednesday, August 9th, 2017, 5:26:12 PM

the responsiveness issues with regards to text and whitespace will be honed eventually, there are major updates planned for this weekend that are currently in staging and we are verifying there are no problems.

After that happens we will reassess what needs to be done.

Please realize (and we the admins all made this mistake first) it is no easy task to simply install a plugin, the NodeBB plugin space is very large with a lot of varying quality of code. We made the mistake of willynilly turning plugins on initially in our glee of customization and accidentally borked the live database, and while I have rolling hourly backups to S3 running, I would prefer not to have to use them and have unscheduled downtime.

I already added a good bit of custom css to make it more friendly to the mobile experience, and your general critiques about margins and paddings being "off" are not incorrect, they are not a critical issue compared to some others.
